name: xordi
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2
body: |- wb(wa(w0, wn(wb(w1, w2))), wn(wb(wa(w0, w1), wa(w0, w2))))

stmt.origin: xchbinx(wa(w0, wn(wb(w1, w2))), wb(wa(w0, w1), wa(w0, w2)), wi(w0, wb(w1, w2)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wa(w0, wn(wb(w1, w2))), wn(wb(wa(w0, w1), wa(w0, w2))))
-| wb(wa(w0, wn(wb(w1, w2))), wn(wi(w0, wb(w1, w2))))
-| wb(wi(w0, wb(w1, w2)), wb(wa(w0, w1), wa(w0, w2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wa(w0, wn(wb(w1, w2))), wn(wb(wa(w0, w1), wa(w0, w2))))
-| wb(wa(w0, wn(wb(w1, w2))), wn(wi(w0, wb(w1, w2))))
-| wb(wi(w0, wb(w1, w2)), wb(wa(w0, w1), wa(w0, w2)))

body.origin: |- wb(wa(w0, wn(wb(w1, w2))), wn(wi(w0, wb(w1, w2))))

cumulated.origin:
|- wb(wa(w0, wn(wb(w1, w2))), wn(wb(wa(w0, w1), wa(w0, w2))))
-| wb(wi(w0, wb(w1, w2)), wb(wa(w0, w1), wa(w0, w2)))

body.origin: |- wb(wi(w0, wb(w1, w2)), wb(wa(w0, w1), wa(w0, w2)))

cumulated.origin: |- wb(wa(w0, wn(wb(w1, w2))), wn(wb(wa(w0, w1), wa(w0, w2))))

comment: Conjunction distributes over exclusive-or, using ` -. ( ph <-> ps ) ` to express exclusive-or. This is one way to interpret the distributive law of multiplication over addition in modulo 2 arithmetic. This is not necessarily true in intuitionistic logic, though ~ anxordi does hold in it. (Contributed by NM, 3-Oct-2008.)
